result.execSummary:
The defendant Amario M Friend was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
Pay supervision fees.
Court set restitution at zero.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Complete anger management. Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
Any other programs as deemed appropriate by the agent.
No contact order with the victim is removed as of today's date.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amario M Friend

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amario M Friend in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 6 months with the following conditions:
- Complete anger management. Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- Any other programs as deemed appropriate by the agent.
- No contact order with the victim is removed as of today's date.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
cab

Defendant Amario M Friend in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered. Case calendared for Sentencing in Br. 36.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: AMI

Defendant Amario M Friend in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The defense has not received the 911 tape but case remains calendared for trial on 03/28/2016 at 08:30 a.m.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Amario M Friend in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel is requesting a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 36.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KMR dob 9/10/87 or her children

Defendant Amario M Friend in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Amario M Friend in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
